questions.question_text: Which SDN architecture component is used by the application layer to communicate with the control plane layer to provide instructions about the resources required by applications?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Northbound APIs are interfaces exposed by the SDN controller that allow applications and higher-level orchestration systems to interact with the underlying network infrastructure. These APIs enable the application layer to communicate its requirements and intentions to the control plane layer, allowing for programmability and automation in network resource provisioning and management.

questions.question_text: A customer has a functional requirement that states HR systems within a data center should be segmented from other systems that reside in the same data center and same VLAN. The systems run legacy applications by using hard-coded IP addresses. Which segmentation method is suitable and scalable for the customer?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
-Transparent firewall bridge two VLANs but same subnet - it's a technique . But in this case there is only one VLAN, and hence VACL is the right option.

Selected Answer: C
I think ans is C.

VACLs (VLAN Access Control Lists) are an effective way to control and segment specific traffic, even within the same VLAN. It is particularly suitable for legacy systems that use hard- coded IP addresses.

Selected Answer: C
Yes C is right

Selected Answer: D
Needs to be scalable - so transparent fw. if it didnt have scalable then vacl

Selected Answer: A
NETCONF (Network Configuration Protocol) is a network management protocol that provides mechanisms for configuring and managing network devices. One of its key features is the ability to distinguish between configuration data (used for device configuration) and operational data (used for monitoring device status and performance). This allows for separate handling and manipulation of these data types.

On the other hand, SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) is primarily focused on monitoring and collecting information from network devices. While SNMP can collect the status of specific fields and retrieve configuration information, it does not provide a clear distinction between configuration data and operational data like NETCONF does.

Selected Answer: A
A, SNMP can retrive, modify & even change credentials of the device

Selected Answer: A
"SNMP does not distinguish between configurational and operational data" in page 1:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/datamodels/configuration/xe-16/data-models-xe-16-book/yang-netconf.pdf

comments.content: Definity SNMP can change configuration of network devices. Otherwise why do you need to type ro or rw in the command? Lots of management tools use SNMP to deploy the configuration for a group of devices.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
while SNMP can retrieve configuration data, it does not provide the ability to modify the configuration of network devices. This is a feature that is only supported by protocols like NETCONF.

choices.D: changing the configuration of specific fields
choices.A: distinguishing between configuration data and operational data
choices.C: collecting the status of specific fields

questions.question_text: Which feature is supported by NETCONF but is not supported by SNMP?

choices.A: After the initial timer exchange, R2 sets its transmission rate to the R1 Desired Min TX interval
choices.D: R2 sets the P-bit on all BFD control packets until R2 sends a packet with the F-bit set
choices.C: Timers renegotiate indefinitely, so the timer exchange phase never converges
choices.B: After the initial timer exchange, R1 sets its transmission rate to the R2 Required Min RX interval

questions.question_text: Two routers R1 and R2 are directly connected through an Ethernet link. Both routers are running OSPF over the Ethernet link and OSPF has been registered with BFD. R1 has been set up to transmit BFD at a 50 ms interval, but R2 can receive only at a 100 ms rate due to platform limitations. What does this mean?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
During the BFD session establishment, the routers exchange timer values: Desired Min TX interval and Required Min RX interval. The Desired Min TX interval indicates the desired transmission rate from the local router (R1 in this case), while the Required Min RX interval indicates the required reception rate on the remote router (R2 in this case).

In the given scenario, R1 will adjust its transmission rate to match the Required Min RX interval of R2, which is 100 ms. This ensures that R2 can receive BFD packets at its maximum capability without being overwhelmed by a higher transmission rate from R1.

Selected Answer: B
Each system, upon receiving a BFD control packet will take the "Required Min RX Interval" and compare it to its own "Desired Min TX Interval" and take the greater (slower) of the two values and use it as the transmission rate for its BFD packets. Thus, the slower of the two systems determines the transmission rate.
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/technologies/tk648/tk365/tk480/technologies_white_paper0900aecd80244005.html

The current specification of Generic Routing Encapsulation [1]
 specifies a protocol for encapsulation of an arbitrary protocol over
 another arbitrary network layer protocol. This document describes
 enhancements by which two fields, Key and Sequence Number, can be
 optionally carried in the GRE Header [1]. The Key field is intended
 to be used for identifying an individual traffic flow within a
 tunnel. The Sequence Number field is used to maintain sequence of
 packets within the GRE Tunnel

Selected Answer: A
The GRE Key and Sequence number extensions are specifically designed to provide session tracking and in-order packet delivery. The Key field helps identify the specific tunnel or session, allowing endpoints to associate packets with the correct session. The Sequence number field ensures that packets are delivered and processed in the correct order at the receiving end.

choices.A: GRE Key and Sequence number extensions
choices.C: GRE Version and Reserved0 extension fields
choices.B: GRE Protocol Type and Checksum extension fields
choices.D: No extension fields are available in the GRE header to track session data and packet sequences

questions.question_text: Which extensions to GRE tunneling provide session tracking and in-order packet delivery in exchange for additional state stored in tunnel endpoints?
